meanings.definition: To cover or coat with sugar.
meanings.sent1: She sugarcoats the cookies before baking them.
meanings.sent2: Mom sugarcoats the cake with frosting for my birthday.
meanings.sent3: The baker sugarcoats the donuts to make them sweeter.
meanings.sent4: The snow sugarcoats the trees, creating a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The chef sugarcoats the pastries to add a touch of sweetness.

meanings.definition: To make something appear more pleasant or attractive than it really is.
meanings.sent1: He sugarcoats the truth to avoid hurting feelings.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement sugarcoats the product to attract more buyers.
meanings.sent3: The movie sugarcoats the villain to make them seem less scary.
meanings.sent4: Her smile sugarcoats the pain she is feeling inside.
meanings.sent5: The painting sugarcoats the reality with vibrant colors.
